name: Hotel Mansart

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights. The rates are reasonable particularly for the area. We stayed in room 409 which did not seem to have been refurbished and whilst it was clean and comfortable it was a little tired. The refurbished rooms are much nicer as our friends had one and definitely worth the price. Ask for a refurbished room and you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great hotel if you get a refurbished room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for New Years. The hotel is lovely; spacious and warm and is in a fantastic central location with metro stops close by and lots of brasseries and bistros also very close.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Don't stay in room 211

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a classic room - 211 which unfortunately stank of smoke. So much so that even leaving the balconette winows open for 12 hrs did nothing but make the room freezing. I asked to change and was told that the hotel was all non-smoking and the hotel was full. We changed on new years day but had to pay to upgrade as there was no availability. Given the stench it would have been nice for them to change rooms without charging us but 211 smelt so bad that I would have paid double to move. Even to another hotel.
reviews.title: Our own home in Paris.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However room 212 was really lovely. The breakfast was one of the best continental breakfasts I've ever had and the staff were incredibly courteous and helpful.
reviews.title: Location, Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I would definitely return. Just not to room 211.
reviews.title: Great location, average service, decent rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the Mansart for one night last weekend. We'd stayed there a few times over 20 years ago and were keen to see how the hotel had changed. Stayed in room 602 right up at the top. Unfortunately the Ritz are renovating so there was an background noise of drilling - we asked what time the works would be finishing on Sat night and were assured that there would be no work on Sunday...... but drilling started bright and early on Sunday morning! Slightly surprised there was no shampoo - and it was impossible to reach the soap from the bath without standing up to reach the soap machine on the wall - and the bath plug mechanism didn't work to let water out. That said - we still loved the hotel and the staff were very helpful and friendly - and we had a lovely stay!
reviews.title: lovely stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Hotel Mansart was enhanced by one of the staff, a young man named Antony who was helpful, informative and very friendly while still utterly professional. We felt that we were in good hands and that nothing was too much trouble for him. Our room, with no outlook, was generous in size with a few steps leading up to our large tiled bathroom. We found the large bath perfect for soaking walk-weary bodies. The central location of the Mansart encourages lots of walking to the many Paris attractions. The bed was comfort plus and initial difficulties with temperature control were soon sorted by a staff member.
reviews.title: Hotel in the heart of Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of interest is the fact that the first exhibition of paintings by a group to become known as The Impressionists was held in a studio at 35 Boulevard des Capucines in 1874.
reviews.title: Great location, charming rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't get any more central. Authentic boutique vibe in the heart of Vendome with classic French style throughout.
reviews.title: Wonderful location but in need of renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A mix up with beds meant we changed room after the first night - Although it took quite a discussion for the hotel to offer this as a solution. That said, both rooms were more than charming and the sleep quality very good.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed here with friends last month. I had a single "club" room. It was perfect for one person (club rooms are in the back of the hotel), and the bed was SO comfy. Very clean and quiet. The staff and the location make this hotel perfect for a stay in Paris. The people who run the Mansart go out of their way to be helpful and kind, which we appreciated enormously. It made such a difference for our beautiful visit to Paris. (See review by Jane G. just before this one - ditto everything she said!)
reviews.title: Hotel Mansart

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I cannot say enough about how wonderful the staff was during our 10 day stay. They made us reservations, called us taxis, walked us to the ATM and greeted us always like we were their favorite guests. Anthony, Pushpa and Steeven and everybody whose name I don't know made our stay special. We loved our rooms, very old fashioned and French but with very good mattresses and showers. High ceilings, crown moldings and those wonderful French windows. The location cannot be beat, next to the Place Vendome walking distance to the Orsay, Orangerie, the Louvre! There is also a taxi stand around the corner. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel because there is an Eric Kayser Patisserie across the street that has amazing croissants, bread, pastries yogurt at great prices...and great coffee. Bring your own shampoo and cream rinse, and the towels could use an upgrade. But these are minor compared to the outstanding service and charm of this hotel!
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You really feel you are in Paris! We stayed here for our Honeymoon last year and we would most certainly stay again. The art work, the decorations, the staff, the ambiance was all just perfect! The Hotel staff was incredibly accomodating and friendly. Our room was a little on the small side (if you are used to the big american hotel rooms), but it was very clean and modern. I absolutely loved the bathroom and the shower. Kind of funny; the Hotel was very modern in an old world type of fashion. If you like to have a drink every now and then; accross the street is the Kitty O'Shea. We pretty much unwinded our day there every night. The location is superb. You are walking distance to many attractions and the nearest metro stop is 5 to 6 minutes away. The Hotel serves a typical french continental breakfast in the morning. I found that it suited there Corporate travelers more. We rather walk around an eat at the cafes. The only problem I had doesn't really have to do with the Hotel as much. Getting there from the airport was quite confusing. You take the bus, but once you get off the bus in the middle of the town it tooks us a pretty long time to get our bearings and find the Hotel. It's approximately 5 minutes from were the bus drops you off, but it took us around 20 to find it.
reviews.title: A Very Romantic Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of Hotel Mansart is perfect, very central. After momentarily getting disorientated after getting the bus from the airport into the Paris city centre, we finally found the hotel. The staff were very friendly, spoke perfect English and were extremely helpful. We stayed in Room 301, having paid extra for a larger room. The room wasn't bad, but wasn't one of the recently renovated ones! The floor had a distinct slope and the heated towel rails in the bathroom did not work. We stayed 5 nights and had a fantastic time - the hotel is just around the corner from Place Vendome and walking distance to Boulevard Haussman, and most importantly, Chanel's main boutique is just around the corner in Rue Cambon! With Bulgari next door, you know you are in the right part of town. We chose not to have breakfasts at the hotel because we felt they were overpriced. There are plenty of bakeries and cafes around, so plenty of options to choose from. Would definitely say here again. One word of caution, just beware of the over enthusiastic cleaning staff who at one time, wanted to clean our room at 8pm.
reviews.title: Perfect location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Location could not have been perfect for both tourist and business travel. Read many reviews of the hotel and balanced that with my own experience with Paris, its hotels and this neighborhood in particular. First, Paris is an old city. To try and compare the homogenity of a big box hotel found in most american cities with hotels in Paris is folly and a road to disappointment as well as inability to enjoy Paris for its charm. This hotel has rooms with older furniture, its true. I stayed twice this month -- in a superior room which had older furniture but was huge by any standard and perfect for a family with small children. I much preferred the Vendome room, newly renovated and perfect for a single traveler or couple. It was just lovely and I would stay there again. In both cases, the bed was well appointed and extremely cozy and comfy. The hotel is very clean and its staff, the best part. Helpful and very warm. I would not hesitate to stay again. The only reason I rated its restaurant facilities poorly is because there really isn't one in the hotel and of course, no pool.
reviews.title: Hotel Mansart was perfect for my stays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Recently refurbished in fantastic location. Staff friendly and happy to assist. Internet "free". Good value for money. Close to Louvre, great restaurants and Place Vendome. Stayed here many times. Spoil yourself with upgrade - stylish rooms.
reviews.title: Great location good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: I only stated one night and wished it was more. Superb location, close to Place Vendome - M.Mansart was its architect - nice shopping, clean safe streets.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great decor, great rooms, superb location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely decor, the room had antique furniture and paintings, small but very new and clean bathroom.
reviews.title: Great hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Nice breakfast but head down early to make the most of it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - good location and large rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a fantastic find! The hotel is around the corner from the Ritz so you would expect to pay top dollar,but we were pleasantly surprised. Amazing rooms,huge with big bathrooms and gorgous fittings. The bed was the best we had slept in in four weeks travel through Europe.
reviews.title: "Our first stay, of many I hope"

description: The Hotel Mansart is ideally located at the corner of the prestigious “Place Vendôme”, a stone away from the “Opera House”, the department stores and the luxurious boutiques of the “Rue Saint-Honoré”, the Tuileries Gardens and the Louvre Museum. This charming hotel welcomes you in a warm and intimate atmosphere with an attentive and friendly staff.
